stanza.line: Thou art as tyrannous so as thou (a)art(/a)
As those whose beauties proudly make them (b)cruel(/b)
For well thou know'st to my dear doting (a)heart(/a)
Thou art the fairest and most precious (b)jewel(/b)
Yet in good faith some say that thee (c)behold(/c)
Thy face hath not the power to make love (d)groan(/d)
To say they err I dare not be so (c)bold(/c)
Although I swear it to my self (d)alone(/d)
And to be sure that is not false I (e)swear(/e)
A thousand groans but thinking on thy (f)face(/f)
One on another's neck do witness (e)bear(/e)
Thy black is fairest in my judgment's (f)place(/f)
In nothing art thou black save in thy (g)deeds(/g)
And thence this slander as I think (g)proceeds(/g)
